title: Wolves vs Everton predictions: Premier League tips and odds
description: Our Wolves vs Everton predictions include a first away win of the season for the Toffees
content:
Wolves are still looking for their first points and goals of the Premier League season ahead of their meeting with Everton at Molineux on Saturday (kick-off, 3pm). But their wait may continue, with the visitors tipped to record a victory on the road.

Odds courtesy of Paddy Power. Correct at the time of publication and subject to change.

Already signed up with Paddy Power? Find more free bets from the best betting sites in the UK, reviewed by our experts.

Everton fans had plenty of cause for concern when they watched their team lose 1-0 at Leeds United in their opening league match, but over the past week, it’s fair to say that the gloom has lifted.

David Moyes’ side recorded an impressive 2-0 win over Brighton in the first competitive game at the Hill Dickinson Stadium last Saturday. That scoreline was repeated against Mansfield Town four days later, a result that booked another visit to Molineux in the third round of the EFL Cup.

The club also secured the signing of talented winger Tyler Dibling from Southampton, while left-back Vitalii Mykolenko returned from injury. Along with the attacking impetus already evidenced by Jack Grealish and Iliman Ndiaye, there are already more reasons to be cheerful than fearful.

Unfortunately for Wolves fans, the same can’t be said for their side. They’re goalless and pointless in the league after defeats by Manchester City and Bournemouth, and a dramatic 3-2 comeback win over West Ham United in the League Cup isn’t likely to brighten the mood too much.

Defensive frailties from the previous campaign have resurfaced, with five goals shipped – a tally that could easily have been more, while centre-back Toti was sent off against Bournemouth. Vitor Pereira saw his team concede 69 goals last term, the highest tally of the non-relegated clubs.

It’s not just at the back where there’s cause for concern. Last season’s top scorer Matheus Cunha was sold to Manchester United and striker Jorgen Strand Larsen looks set to follow. He scored 14 goals last term and has been the subject of several bids from Newcastle United.

Now winless in six games dating back to the end of last season, Wolves host an Everton side who have won five of their 10 away league games since Moyes’ return. They have suffered just three defeats in that time, two of which were against Liverpool and Chelsea.

Everton appear overpriced at 15/8 to exploit the problems at Molineux and we’re backing them to take all three points.

Dewsbury-Hall in the thick of the action

Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall looks set to be central to Everton’s ambitions this season. The midfielder moved from Chelsea in the summer and has had a key impact on the Toffees’ two games so far.

The former Leicester City man was deployed in a more advanced role on Sunday against Brighton, against whom he played four key passes and had 58 touches of the ball, both of which improved on the figures for his debut at Leeds.

At the same time, he lost possession on 10 occasions, conceded a penalty, gave away two fouls and was booked late on by referee Stuart Attwell. What’s very clear for all to see is that Dewsbury-Hall is going to be heavily involved at both ends of the pitch.

As Everton are likely to field an unchanged team from the win over Brighton, the 2/1 on offer for Dewsbury-Hall to commit two fouls again is interesting.

With 19 losses of possession over two games and 12 ground duel involvements, you can be sure he won’t be far from the centre of the battle.

All odds courtesy of Paddy Power. Correct at the time of publication and subject to change.
summary: Wolves and Everton are set to meet at Molineux in the Premier League, where Wolves are still searching for their first points and goals of the season. Everton, however, is predicted to win on the road, with the team having won five of their 10 away league games since David Moyes' return. Despite this, Wolves are currently goalless and pointless in the league, despite a 3-2 comeback win over West Ham United in the League Cup. Everton's top scorer last season was sold to Manchester United and striker Jorgen Strand Larsen is also expected to follow. Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall is expected to be central to Everton's ambitions this season, having already played a key role in their win over Brighton.
shortSummary: Wolves and Everton face off at Molineux with both teams searching for their first points and goals of the season, while Everton's recent victories have prompted optimism.
argos_summary: Wolves are winless and struggling to score, while Everton have regained form under Moyes with five of their last ten away wins, including recent 2-0 victories over Brighton and Mansfield. Everton’s squad has benefited from the return of key players and the signing of Tyler Dibling, while Wolves face defensive frailties and the loss of top scorer Matheus Cunha. Dewsbury‑Hall, a new Everton midfielder, is expected to play a central role in the upcoming match. Betting odds favor Everton to take all three points at Molineux.
